udat_ipdata\\\r\\n\
\\r\\n\\\
Syntax: \array udat_ipdata(\$category: \\\\\<string\\\\\>, \$name: \\\\\<string\>)\\\\r\\n\
Description: Look up IP data for a particular account (\$name) in a\\r\\nparticular category (\\"text\\" or \\"http\\") and return a two-dimensional\\r\\narray listing the available data, ordered newest-to-oldest.\\\\r\\n\\
Tips, tricks, comments\\
Adopting the +finger \\"last IP\\":\\UserAPI::udat_ipdata(\$name:\\"nino\\",\\r\\n\$category:\\"text\\") or UserAPI::udat_ipdata(\$name:\\"nino\\",\\r\\n\$category:\\"http\\"), take the last entry in the arrays returned, the\\r\\nfirst element is the ipnumber, the second the ipname, the third the\\r\\nmost recent timestamp and the fourth and last is how many times in a\\r\\nrow it has been used.\\\\
\Figuring out the account name based on the UDAT object:\\\You can find out what account name a particular UDAT object is associated with by checking its \\"skotos:name\\" property.\\\[/noparse]\\\r\\n"
